update.description:
This fixes a compile error when building against sdformat default. The variant does not contain `gazebo::common::Color`, so a `Param::Get()` cannot succeed.

Since `gazebo::common::Color` is deprecated this PR also deprecates and adds alternatives to some methods that use `common::Color` in their signature. It doesn't replace all uses of `common::Color`, just enough to get the build complete plus a tiny bit more so that `common::Color` functions are deprecated in the files that had compile errors.
update.title: Fix compile error due gazebo::common::Color and sdformat

content.raw:
That test is in my email archive for having failed before, most recently here:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/gazebo-ci_BTRelease-default-xenial-amd64-gpu-none/56/testReport/junit/(root)/PhysicsEngines_ImuTest/ImuSensorTestWorld_0/

It looks like a flaky test to me. Can you reproduce the failing on your own machine by running it multiple times?

~~~
while test/integration/INTEGRATION_imu; do date >> imu.txt; done
~~~

That prints the timestamp to a file each time the build passes so you can count how often it fails.

content.raw:
do we want to keep `ColorIgn` as replacement API? 


We could maybe still keep the `Color()` API name and just change the return type to `ignition::math::Color` by  adding overloaded functions to `common Color`, e.g. `Color(const ignition::math::Color &)` and maybe also `operator=(const ignition::math::Color &)`? In these functions we can print out the deprecation warnings.
content.html:
do we want to keep ColorIgn as replacement API?

We could maybe still keep the Color() API name and just change the return type to ignition::math::Color by adding overloaded functions to common Color, e.g. Color(const ignition::math::Color &) and maybe also operator=(const ignition::math::Color &)? In these functions we can print out the deprecation warnings.

content.raw: Correct. `ignition::math::Color` clamps the values on the interval [0, 1]. These tests fail because the color was internally converted to the ignition type in `SetEmissive(gazebo::common::Color)`, so the color returned by `GetEmissive()` has clamped values instead of the original ones.
content.html: Correct. ignition::math::Color clamps the values on the interval [0, 1]. These tests fail because the color was internally converted to the ignition type in SetEmissive(gazebo::common::Color), so the color returned by GetEmissive() has clamped values instead of the original ones.
